message: Who do you prefer to register your domain names with?
namecheap
I used domain in seconds. Price was fine. It worked. I guess that's a positive referral.
name.com
I second name.com.
gandi.net — been using them for 14 years. great terms of service. they recently updated their motto to be "no bullshit™"
I'm trying to find a new registrar also. I can only recommend people to AVOID 123-reg, they're disgraceful
iwantmyname.com are excellent. Genuinely nice management UI and fast support
omnis.com
dynadot - professional, secure, and they don't dick me around (I'm looking at you, 123 Reg)
I will third name.com they have the cleanest site, no ads, no clutter, and finding obscure TLDs is very very easy with them.
namecheap!
They're nothing special, but dotster.com hasn't offended me in 9 years.

I've been using enom.com solely because I got a reseller account before they charged huge fees and now I can have sub-accounts where my friends/clients have their domains and pay their renewals but I have full access for management purposes. 

Also, Gandi.net is a rip-off at $15/year for a .com!!! I pay $8.50!! Managing 20+ domains means saving $130+/year… and that's a lot of cash!!! :|
hover.com - no bull. good interface. backed by a first-rate company (Tucows)
ovh.ie
For the record, I don't like enom.com that much… Nothing wrong with it but I dislike the interface and the "feel" of the company (with all its shady ghost companies and registrars…)
I like gandi.net. 15$ is a nice price when you factor in built in whois protection, and good service. I'm happy to pay that much.
name.com also
@NARKOZ are OVH good for domains? I use them for hosting, they're mediocre but you get what you pay for (in my case, very little)
Dynadot for me..
I've used domainmonger and godaddy.
I am withdrawing my Dynadot recommendation having received this this morning... have you ever seen anything like it @Leech?

To minimize credit card fraud, sometimes we ask our customers to verify their identity. Please send us a copy of your credit card.

1. Send by fax: +1-415-869-2893 (secure)
2. Send by email attachment: info@dynadot.com (not secure)

If we do not receive this within 2 days, we reserve the right to cancel your domain name or web hosting.
@ZoFreX That has scam written all over it. Are you sure that is from Dynadot?
Great Topic! I STILL keep going back to GoDaddy and their week long up sell. Definately be checking out some of your suggestions this time round. Thanks Convorians :)
I like Name.com (Denver-based). Least bullshit of all the USA-based registrars. Unfortunately, they don't have all TLDs; I use Gandi.net for everything else.
@johntracy Yes, it was from Dynadot http://www.dynadot.com/community/forums/f4-payment-issues/dynadot-slackness-on-protecting-cc-info-78_1.html
@ZoFreX ah, I haven't received it because I use Paypal for domains. I prefer my credit card tied to one service (paypal in this case) than zillions..
Another plug for Hover.  Recently moved over from GoDaddy and the transition was awesome.  Painless, professional and no upsell.
GoDaddy.com had good prices and frequent offers, with 1and1.co.uk for UK domains
Godaddy has screwed me a couple of times js
I use namecheap, it could have a better layout of the features, but it stands by its namesake.
Using GoDaddy to manage 50+ domains. Need to get more cron jobs. Any idead? I am limited to 10 now
Anything but GoDaddy whenever possible. Love Name.com
*ideas
http://www.namecheap.com/contest/2-million-offer.aspx
another vote for hover.com.
Me ;) actually it's a tucows front end like hover...

I use hovers. I don't have a ton of domains that I need to administer with a hundred different redirects. I just need to point a domain to my blog and to the apps i make. Its fast an easy. I definitely recommend it.
hover*
I also want to caution everyone about Godaddy.  I've had poor experiences with them.  I don't use them anymore.  Granted, they are cheap... but not worth it IMHO.
on hover for non .xxx.au sites. 1. supporting twit.tv shows 2. it's cheaper than godaddy IF you want domain privacy (at least it was when i migrate everything). Now, if only hover also sells SSL :3
I use hover as well
I've been using godaddy - just want to ask people what sort of bad experiences?
Never godaddy. Their JS UI is awful and it's almost impossible to move away (I migrated off it a couple of years ago and it tooks forever and a bunch of hand-made GreaseMonkey scripts).

NameCheap has been good. Gandi is okay but with some weird support issues. e.g. I registered some names, they somehow had to do a manual payment processing, so without notifying me, they just left them in a queue for three days, meaning someone else could easily come along and take them. I logged a ticket on the first day (a Saturday, when they say they have support all day) and it took them 3 days to get back to me (Tuesday).
Webhost Giant
i use dynadot.com
gandi.net
I us both namecheap.com and name.com and I slightly prefer the latter...
Fairly happy with Hover, some domains are a bit more expensive than anywhere else (like .co) but good service so far.
haha
I decided to go with gandi.net. I'm very happy with it so-far.
